title: Where Are My Things?
description: Have you ever lost something special to you? In Where Are My Things? Tosh has to figure out what happened to all of his collections. Colorful illustrations and high-frequency words make this story perfect for early readers. The book can also be used to teach students how to identify the problem and solution as well as how to identify and use interrogative sentences.
meta: branches, collecting, marbles, roots, stamp, trunk
Connect to prior knowledge to understand text
Problem and Solution : Identify problem and solution
Syllable Awareness : Recognize and identify syllables
Interrogative Sentences : Recognize and use interrogative sentences
Alphabetical Order : Place words in alphabetical order

Promote higher-order thinking for small groups
or whole class
